intro: Erigeron neocaledonicus, commonly known as the New Caledonia fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and has small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Erigeron neocaledonicus is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance.
